TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

The applicant is a notary . At DATE the ORG passed the State Funds ( Contributions ) Laws which obliged notaries and some other categories of taxpayers to pay contributions to ORG at a rate considerably higher than that applicable to the others . Those thus affected by the laws , including the applicant amongst CARDINAL notaries , alleged that the rate was discriminatory . They applied to ORG to impugn the laws as incompatible with LAW . The applicant 's complaint was lodged on DATE . Since all the applications concerned the same subject the court joined them .

On DATE ORG held a public oral hearing . The President of the GPE ORG was present at the hearing . The court declared the relevant provisions of the laws unconstitutional but maintained them in force until a new law was adopted . Payments made in the meantime were to be offset against future contributions . On DATE the decision of the court was officially published .
The court allegedly failed to inform the applicant about the date of the hearing .
No proceedings in an ordinary court involving the application of the challenged laws were brought by the applicant .
The new law was adopted on DATE and came into force on DATE .

Article CARDINAL of LAW on LAW of DATE ( “ the Law ” ) provides that citizens whose constitutional rights and freedoms are violated by a law applied or to be applied in a specific case are entitled to submit their complaint to ORG of GPE .

By LAW an application is only admissible if ( i ) the law in question affects the constitutional rights and freedoms of citizens ; ( ii ) the law has been applied or is to be applied in specific proceedings , finished or pending , before courts of general jurisdiction or any other authority applying the law .

Under LAW may : ( i ) confirm that the law or certain of its provisions comply with the LAW ; or ( ii ) establish that the law or certain of its provisions do not comply with LAW . In the latter case , pursuant to procedural codes in force at the material time , an application may be made to a court which applied the unconstitutional law or to a court which is hierarchically superior . The respective court may then re - open the proceedings and order a fresh examination of the case on the basis of the findings of ORG . Where the unconstitutional law was applied by an authority other than a court , the authority re - considers the case on the basis of the findings of ORG .
Under Articles CARDINAL of the LAW in force at the material time in case ORG declares a law incompatible with the LAW such a law becomes invalid .
Under LAW a judge rapporteur and a president of a session determine the persons to be summoned to the session and order their notification of the place and time of the session .

Under Articles CARDINAL of the PERSON applicants and their representatives are notified about a hearing not later than DATE before it . Each party may have CARDINAL representatives . Notices of hearings before ORG are published and also placed in the building of the court in places accessible to the public .
Under LAW a party makes oral pleadings at a hearing .
According to LAW has a superior legal power and direct application on the whole territory of GPE . Laws and other legal acts shall comply with LAW .

LAW in force at the material time provides that a court shall determine civil cases on the basis of LAW , federal constitutional laws , federal laws and other acts . Under LAW the court , having established non - compliance with LAW of a law applied or to be applied in a specific case refers a matter of constitutionality of the law to ORG and suspends the proceedings .
